In Iowa earlier this week, I met 88-year-old activist Mary Campos who had some good advice. She said: “there’s nothing that can replace a phone call or a knock on the door.” We have 9 days left to knock on doors and talk with people one-on-one. Let’s give it everything we have.

Yesterday was a tragic reminder that the ancient evil of antisemitism is still with us. That among us lurk those who do not just say or write horrible things, but could, at any moment, turn hatred into unimaginable violence. https://twitter.com/jgreenblattadl/status/1056594808066727936 QT @JGreenblattADL This man was not just an #antiSemite, but someone who regularly shared virulent white supremacist rhetoric online. This vile #hate led to the deadliest attack against Jews in American history. Our experts have the full background. https://www.adl.org/blog/deadly-shooting-at-pittsburgh-synagogue

Students should be able to go to college without being weighed down by mountains of debt. It’s time we make college tuition-free.

.@BretStephensNYT not sure what your response has to do with my tweet which was clearly about the mail bomber not the antisemitic Synagogue attack as evidenced by the fact it was written before the attack & was a RT of something I wrote earlier in the week about the mail bomber. https://twitter.com/bretstephensnyt/status/1056554592929046528 QT @BretStephensNYT Here's why, Senator: Trump routinely defames "globalists" and "international banks" and "corrupt media," all of which anti-Semites associate with Jews. Responsible rhetoric begins by not demonizing entire categories of people, or giving deranged people mental ammunition. https://twitter.com/marcorubio/status/1056171704131768320

I want to thank the many activists I met with who informed me about these important ballot measures nationwide which can help us create a fairer and just society. We must rise to the historic occasion and make sure we have record voter turnout so we can transform this nation.
RT @PatrickSvitek The latest @TedCruz surrogate to hit the #txsen trail: @SenMikeLee. Lee is set to join Cruz for his bus tour stops tomorrow in Harlingen, Mission and Laredo.

With the recent report from the IPCC noting the drastic action required to prevent the worst impacts of climate change, Initiative 1631 is an important step forward for the people of Washington State.

Question 1 in Massachusetts would set a safe maximum on the number of patients nurses can treat, so that patients can receive the quality care they deserve. Nurses are behind this initiative, and I trust them when it comes to knowing what is best for their patients.

Florida has the opportunity to re-enfranchise 1.4 million formerly incarcerated people to fully participate as citizens. Passing Amendment 4 is an important step for both voting rights and criminal justice reform.

Given the crisis we face with climate change, in my view we should move toward a total ban on fracking. At a minimum, it seems obvious that we must protect communities from the environmental damage that fracking causes. In my view Colorado voters should support 112.

Colorado Amendment 74, pushed by the fossil fuel industry, seems to be one of the most dangerous propositions in the country. It could open the flood gates for oil, gas and other corporate interests to bankrupt the state. This extremely dangerous amendment must be defeated.

How is it possible that in Colorado a majority of school districts can only afford to keep their schools open 4 days a week? How are teachers paid wages so low that some have to work two jobs to survive? Our kids deserve a high-quality education. Amendment 73 is a no-brainer.

Currently California cities and towns aren't permitted to pass rent control measures to address the affordable housing crisis. That should change. Municipalities should have the freedom to deal with the decline in affordable housing and rising rents. Let's pass Prop 10.

Today, I would like to endorse some of the measures on the ballot in states across the country.

California: Proposition 10.
Florida: Amendment 4.
Colorado: Amendment 73, Amendment 74, and Proposition 112.
Massachusetts: Question 1.
Washington: Initiative 1631.
Lewistown, Montana is ready to elect @MattForMontana http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DqoDP-GVsAADnUR.jpg

This week in 1949, President Harry Truman nearly doubled the federal minimum wage from 40 cents an hour to 75 cents. Our current federal minimum wage of $7.25 was set back in 2009 and hasn’t increased with the cost of living. It’s time to raise the wage.

While HATE is a sad feature of our fallen nature,tapping into ANGER for political gain is a choice. One both the left & right now fully embrace. And while the politics of ANGER may not driven by HATE, those who do HATE can be driven to violence by the politics of ANGER.

Join us tomorrow in Harlingen, Mission, and Laredo! #KeepTexasRed
